intro: Alinorchis tricruris, commonly known as the three-lobed orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique three-lobed flower structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features include slender stems, lance-shaped leaves, and small, intricate flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a threatened species in many areas.
